positions.title: University of Bath
positions.subtitle: Research Associate: Centre for Photonics and Photonic Materials
comments: Building novel fibre optic components for a quantum computing and communication
Connectorizing hollow core optical fibres
Desiging photon pair sources
Implementing a low-loss fibre switch
Interfacing photons with microresonators
Development of quantum memory techniques
Overseeing work of postgraduate students in the laboratory

positions.title: Imperial College London
positions.subtitle: PhD: Controlled Quantum Dynamics
comments: Student in controlled quantum dynamics centre for doctoral training
Achieved distinction in master’s year
Designed and microfabricated a chip trap for robust containment and control of cold molecules (thesis)
Applications in quantum technology, thermodynamics and communications

positions.title: University of Oxford

Master’s project: use of compressed sensing in plasma wakefield accelerators

positions.title: Superconducting qubits, Department of Physics, Unviersity of Oxford

positions.title: Unconventional computing, YCCSA, University of York
comments: Undertook research into novel forms of classical computation using nuclear magnetic resonance
Utilised this well-understood “sandbox” environment to implement systems with continuous logic

positions.title: Open machine learning course, Open Data Science
